result.execSummary:
The defendant Reginald L McClain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court does NOT grant early termination of Probation.  May be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Any term deemed appropriate by Agent. No contact with Southwest Metal Finishers or any victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Restitution in the amount of $7674.68 to be paid for Southwest Metal Finishing ($4000.00 prepaid to the District Attorney's Trust Account.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation. Restitution to be paid before costs and fines.

timeConds.notes: Huber, non working hours.  Defendant to report by 6:00 pm Wednesday, June 8, 2016.  May be transferred to Milwaukee County, but the Court does NOT authorize electronic monitoring.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Reginald L McClain in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 of the amended information.  Court finds defendant guilty.  The Court sets sentencing in about 45 days to allow for additional time for upfront restitution.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
From Atty Misfeldt dated 3/9/16 requesting adjournment of plea and sentencing scheduled for 3/14/16.

Defendant Reginald L McClain in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Misfeldt requests the Court set the matter for a plea only.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Reginald L McClain in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Reginald L McClain in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
